metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3018 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: InnoDB). Supported versions that are affected are 8.0.17 and prior. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows high privileged attacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized ability to cause a hang or frequently repeatable crash (complete DOS) of MySQL Server. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 4.4 (Availability impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: mariadb-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mysql-5.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
mysql-5.6: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
